fields.headline: Regional government on the internet
fields.bodyText: For more information on the regions, here are eight websites to have a look at. Regions map - shows the boundaries of the English regions and the regional development agencies that cover them. www.local-regions.detr.gov.uk North east consitutional convention - a short summary of the convention's early work on a regional government model for the area. www.northeastassembly.org.uk The Campaign for the English Regions - a lobbying organisation dedicated to devolution. www.cfer.org.uk Guide to regional development agencies - find your local regional development agency, and learn more about what they do. www.local-regions.detr.gov.uk The government's most recent research - what ministers are learning from international experiences. www.local.detr.gov.uk/research/regngovn.htm The Guardian's guide to how devolution is working in Scotland. www.guardianunlimited.co.uk/Scotland Charter 88 - constitutional reform group pushing for action on regional government. www.charter88.org.uk Labour's 1997 general election manifesto - read the party's pledge to devolve power to the English regions. www.politicos.co.uk
